report.title: Short Jolts for Me
report.author: Midwest Hoss
report.bodytext: The primary materials I use are: the tin exterior of a tea lite candle, and a rock. /n /n 1. Over a lit candle, I put one anadenanthera seed in the tea lite tin. I hold this tin with pliers. /n /n 2. I wait for that seed to either expand in size, or pop and then put it off to the side. /n /n 3. Repeat for as many seeds as needed. /n /n 4. After getting 3-4 expanded seeds, I carefully remove the outer shell. /n /n 5. The inside should still be a yellow or off white color. I grind the yellow seeds up, until they are a fine powder. /n /n 6. Enjoy my Yopo. /n /n With 1-2 seeds, I use it much like the Yanomamo tribe at times of hunting, as a stimulant. One or two seeds is just enough to get me going for a short period of time, and also puts me at ease. For me, it is like a calm jolt of energy.
